page.title: 05FARMING AROUND ROYSTON
page.content: The visits to {Mr Hoys' farms}took place on the 4th.June 1985. Mr Hoy is in partnership with his brother and between them they own Hyde Hill Farm, New Farm and Holland Hill Farm. The farm covers 850 acres of land, incorporating 25-30 fields.The land is wooded in places and there are two plantations with young trees.The{type {of farming}carried out in this area is largely arable as the{soil}is light and chalky which is ideal for many {crops.}Mr Hoy grows oats,wheat,barley, beans,oil-seed rape,clover and rye grass in his fields.These are used for animal fodder,bedding and human consumption.The barley is used in the local brewing trade and the wheat is purchased by Weetabix in Welwyn.Mr Hoy also keeps{cattle.}The breeds include Murray Grey,Aberdeen Angus,and Charolais.In the winter months 60-80
